meanings.definition: The physical characteristics of an endomorph, such as a round body shape and tendency to store fat.
meanings.sent1: Her endomorphies include a round body shape and a tendency to store fat.
meanings.sent2: Endomorphies like a round body shape and fat storage are common in some individuals.
meanings.sent3: Despite her endomorphies, she loves to dance and stay active.
meanings.sent4: His endomorphies were like a fortress, protecting him from the cold.
meanings.sent5: The endomorphies of the bear made it easy to identify among other animals.

meanings.definition: The genetic traits that contribute to an individual being classified as an endomorph.
meanings.sent1: The endomorphies in his DNA clearly indicated his classification.
meanings.sent2: Genetic endomorphies play a significant role in determining body type.
meanings.sent3: The endomorphies in her genes made her stand out in the family.
meanings.sent4: His endomorphies were like a secret code embedded in his DNA.
meanings.sent5: The endomorphies passed down through generations shaped their family's appearance.

meanings.definition: The study of endomorphies in relation to human biology and evolution.
meanings.sent1: She dedicated her life to the research of endomorphies in human biology.
meanings.sent2: Endomorphies are a fascinating subject in the study of human evolution.
meanings.sent3: The professor's lecture on endomorphies was both informative and engaging.
meanings.sent4: The exploration of endomorphies shed light on human biological diversity.
meanings.sent5: The book delved deep into the mysteries of endomorphies and their significance.
